Method Detail

toConcrete

SymbolicFormula toConcrete(SymbolicFormulaManager mgr,
                           AbstractFormula af)
Returns:
a concrete representation of af The formula returned is a "generic" version, not instantiated to any particular "SSA step" (see SymbolicFormulaManager.instantiate()).

toAbstract

AbstractFormula toAbstract(SymbolicFormulaManager mgr,
                           SymbolicFormula f,
                           SSAMap ssa,
                           java.util.Collection<Predicate> predicates)
Computes the predicate abstraction of the given formula

Parameters:
mgr - the manager for the symbolic formula
f - the formula to abstract
ssa - the SSAMap to use for resolving variable names
predicates - the list of predicates
Returns:
the predicate abstraction of f

entails

boolean entails(AbstractFormula f1,
                AbstractFormula f2)
checks whether the data region represented by f1 is a subset of that represented by f2

Parameters:
f1 - an AbstractFormula
f2 - an AbstractFormula
Returns:
true if (f1 => f2), false otherwise

isFalse

boolean isFalse(AbstractFormula f)
checks whether f represents "false"

Returns:
true if f represents logical falsity, false otherwise

makeTrue

AbstractFormula makeTrue()
Returns:
a representation of logical truth
